ccre.ctrl

Class StateMachine

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.ctrl.StateMachine

  • public class StateMachine
extends java.lang.Object
    A finite-state machine. This has a number of named, predefined states, which can be switched between, and can affect the functionality of other parts of the code. Users can be notified when a state is exited or entered, and can switch between states either regarding or disregarding the current state. They can also, of course, determine the current state.
    Author:
    skeggsc

    • Constructor Detail

      • StateMachine

        public StateMachine(java.lang.String defaultState,
            java.lang.String... names)
        Create a new StateMachine with a named defaultState and a list of state names. The names cannot be null or duplicates.
        Parameters:
        defaultState - the state to initially be in.
        names - the names of the states.

      • StateMachine

        public StateMachine(int defaultState,
            java.lang.String... names)
        Create a new StateMachine with an indexed defaultState and a list of state names.
        Parameters:
        defaultState - the state to initially be in, as an index in the list of names.
        names - the names of the states.

      • autologTransitions

        public void autologTransitions(LogLevel level,
                      java.lang.String prefix)
        Whenever the state changes, log a message constructed from the prefix concatenated with the name of the current state. No space is inserted automatically - include that in the prefix.
        Parameters:
        level - the logging level at which to log the message.
        prefix - the prefix of the message to log.
